#summary Templates

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

= Introduction =

It's a very common feature request the ability to customize table designs.

Fortunately ZFDatagrid has support for templates, and make the use easy.

== Who uses templates?==
At this moment templates are supported by 

 * Tables
 * PDF
 * Print
 * Word
 * Word 2007
 * Open Document Text
 * Open Document Spreadsheet

==How do they work?==

===First Step===
You template must extend the base template you are creating.

If you are creating a new template for a table you must declare your class like this:
{{{
class My_Template_Table_Table extends Bvb_Grid_Template_Table_Table{}
}}}

===Second Step===
Register you template in the grid.

{{{
$grid->addTemplateDir('My/Template/Table','My_Template_Table','table') 
1. The dir location
2. The class name
3. Template type
}}}

====Templates Types:====
 * table
 * print
 * pdf
 * ods
 * odt
 * word
 * wordx

===Third Step===
Define the template:
This can be as simple as :

{{{
$grid->setTemplate($templateName,$TemplateType(table, print,pdf));
}}}


===Passing Params to the template==
Templates are classes without inheritance.

If you want to pass any user defined information to the template you must one of this options:

{{{
$grid->addTemplateParam('name','value');
}}}


{{{
$grid->addTemplateParams(array);
}}}

{{{
$grid->setTemplateParams(array);
}}}

*<font color="red">Attention</font>:* Using the set method, all previous params will be unset.

===Getting Params from the Template===
After setting the params you can access them within your template in the options property.

{{{
$myParams = $htis->options['userDefined];
}}}
